title: Randomness Example
subtitle: Math.random() in Lab is not truly random - simulations are repeatable
about: Click play and observe which atoms are being marked every 7ps. Note that each time you reload
the whole page, the atom placement and marking sequence will be exactly the same.
The *model reload* will generate a new basic seed, so the simulation will be different than
the first run. However each time you reload the model e.g. 3 times, you will see exactly
the same simulation progress. The seed generated during model reload is sequential and
You can open browser console where you will see marked atoms indices.
